sense.name: social domain or sphere restricted to certain members
sense.examples: The civil service became the preserve of the educated middle class. Medicine and politics are no longer strictly male preserves.

sense.name: a nature reserve where animals are protected
sense.examples: These big cats largely live now in African nature preserves. No deer hunting is permitted in this preserve.

sense.name: fruit cooked down with sugar, jam
sense.examples: Mary's homemade strawberry preserves are delicious. Their pantry was filled with canned vegetables and preserves made from their own garden.
